snippet: Separate plans promoted by the Iraqi government and by a provincial leader stem from the same conviction: that insurgents are best fought with homegrown troops.
abstract: Gov Atheel al-Nujaifi of Nineveh Province in Iraq is trying to assemble a 3,000-person militia, mostly of local Sunnis, to drive Islamic State in Iraq and Syria extremists out of Mosul; his plan dovetails conceptually with new national security strategy, announced by Prime Min Haider al-Abadi, to create national guard forces under authority of the nation's provincial governors.
lead_paragraph: Separate plans promoted by the Iraqi government and by a provincial leader stem from the same conviction: that insurgents are best fought with homegrown troops.

headline.main: Under New Plan, Iraq’s Fight Against Militants May Fall to Its Provinces
headline.print_headline: Under New Plan, Iraq’s Fight Against Militants May Fall to Its Provinces

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
